snippet.title: Lordlings of Yore for the Apple II
snippet.description:
Came also out for:

---


Game description:

Lordlings of Yore is a turn-based strategy game for 1-4 players. You name your kingdom, choose a password and, if you like, modify the terrain. Each player can also choose their own handicaps and player 1 can choose the handicaps for the computer opponents. 

In the game are different phases: The necromancer phase (where you have a magician of sorts who can cast a fog at a certain area, ideal for covering troops which you place like in a chess game and important territories), the treasury phase (where you hire troops, get information and more and look how much gold you have) and the options phase, where you can message other players, save and quit the game.

After the phases are done, the next player in the row will make his\her turn.


What I think:

It has nice ideas, but playing it alone is rather dull. 
You certainly need other HUMAN players to play with.
